results.title: Help me die
results.creator_credit: Brenda Buratti, Lori Hope and KGW-TV Portland
results.brief_description: This program explores the controversial issue of euthanasia and probes the ethical issues involved when terminally ill loved ones ask a physician or family member for assistance in ending their life. It profiles individuals who want to end their pain through suicide, as well as others who seek pain relief through medication - or through programs which will allow them to die with dignity. This documentary invites us all to examine more closely conceptions of personal rights and responsibilities.

results.title: Hello possums
results.creator_credit: Karl Steinberg, ABC-TV (Australia) and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description: In Australia they’re precious. In New Zealand they’re pests. A native to Australia, the possum does its best to adapt to the ever increasing suburban sprawl, nesting in our rooves and our backyard trees. In New Zealand however where the species was introduced to bolster the fur industry, this ‘native favourite’ becomes an ‘introduced pest’, competing for the precious food supply with New Zealand’s native birds, leading to its culling by forestry employees and hunters. Presented by Richard Morecroft.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 9 & 10
results.creator_credit: Paul Drane, Eve Ash, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: The first episode examines the Australian enthusiasm for sport and how this may be intimidating for a new migrant. Addresses the importance of standing up for one’s rights in situations where others may take advantage of a migrant’s lack of familiarity with English. The second episode outlines the importance of accepting cultural differences so as not give offence as well as examining the use of common idioms. A degree of familiarity with spoken English is assumed.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 7 & 8
results.creator_credit: Paul Drane, Eve Ash, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: Children of migrants are often the first to learn English and become familiar with customs. This program outlines how this may cause misunderstandings between parent and child. The issue of how a non-English speaker may break a law unconsciously because they are unfamiliar with the written word is discussed. The second episode looks at the different types of families which exist in Australia and skills that may be used to ensure that a person can get what they want when they go shopping. A degree of familiarity with spoken English is assumed.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 3 & 4.
results.creator_credit: Paul Drane, Eve Ash and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: Parts 3 and 4 of a series designed to give migrants more confidence in using English and to help them understand more about the Australian language and people. Short skits on subjects like going to a barbecue, ringing the emergency services, using the telephone are acted out to give a better understanding of Australian customs and the English language. Featuring George Donikian, Kay Stammers and Rod Quantok.

results.title: Hello Australia. Episodes 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Paul Drane, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description: Hello Australia is a series to develop better understanding of the English language and mainstream Australian culture and customs. Episodes 1 & 2 consist of short dramatisations of everyday situations involving the law regarding compulsory schooling until 15, sending notes to teachers when students are absent from school, Adult Migrant Education Services to improve English and therefore employment prospects in Australia, and learning English on the job. Featuring Rod Quantock as Dr Know and hosted by Kay Stammers and SBS newsreader, George Donikian.

results.title: Hellfire
results.creator_credit: John Coles, Marcus Viscidi and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: This fictional drama is about a popular television evangelist, Reverend Woode, who believes that his interpretation of scripture holds the key to salvation. ‘Hellfire’ explores the controversies of contemporary religious doctrine and is a dynamic discussion tool for any group.

results.title: Hell unlimited
results.brief_description: Puppets, diagrams, animation and live-action were combined to present an anti-war message for use by peace organisations. This film, made while McLaren was studying at the Glasgow School of Art, attracted the attention of John Grierson who later invited him to work in London at the General Post Office’s Film Unit.
